Breeding adult.description: Brandt's Cormorants are larger than Pelagic Cormorants. Breeding birds have a blue skin patch while breeding Pelagics's have a smaller red skin patch on the chin.

Juvenile.description: Juvenile Brandt's Cormorants have a pale neck and breast whereas juvenile Pelagic Cormorants have a dark neck and breast.

Breeding adult.description: Double-crested Cormorants are larger than Pelagic Cormorants with an orangish patch around the bill that Pelagic Cormorants do not have.

Juvenile.description: Double-crested Cormorants are larger than Pelagic Cormorants. Juveniles have a pale neck and breast whereas juvenile Pelagics have a dark neck and breast.

Breeding male.description: Red-breasted Mergansers are smaller than Pelagic Cormorants with a more compact body and a red bill.

Female/nonbreeding male.description: Red-breasted Mergansers are smaller than Pelagic Cormorants with a more compact body and a red bill.
